most_active_tickets.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux

common_issues.title: Ollama Installation Failure on Linux
common_issues.description: Users on Linux OS version 11.0.0 encounter an "Ollama failed to install" error dialog in the Pieces desktop app when initiating installation.  The error message "404 Publisher Model not found" suggests a potential issue with the Gemini-pro model access during installation. Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and provide a solution.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate the root cause of the "Ollama failed to install" error on Linux (specifically version 11.0.0). The error message "404 Publisher Model not found" suggests a potential issue with Gemini-pro model access during installation.
Prioritize resolution of the Ollama installation issue on Linux as it blocks new users and is a known issue.
Update support documentation or FAQs with troubleshooting steps for the Ollama installation issue on Linux, if a temporary workaround is available.
